direction.raw_text: There is a line of fairy tale creatures. The head of the guard sits at a table paying people for bringing the fairy tale creatures to him. There are cages all around. Some of the people in line are Peter Pan, who is carrying Tinkerbell in a cage, Gipetto who's carrying Pinocchio, and a farmer who is carrying the three little pigs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gipetto takes the money and walks off. The old woman steps up to the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Donkey just looks up at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The guards grab the old woman and she struggles with them. One of her legs flies out and kicks Tinkerbell out of Peter Pan's hands, and her cage drops on Donkey's head. He gets sprinkled with fairy dust and he's able to fly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hits the ground with a thud.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Donkey keeps running and he eventually runs into Shrek. Literally. Shrek turns around to see who bumped into him. Donkey looks scared for a moment then he spots the guards coming up the path. He quickly hides behind Shrek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He looks behind the guard and the guard turns to look as well and we see that the other men have run off. The guard tucks tail and runs off. Shrek laughs and goes back about his business and begins walking back to his cottage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shrek turns and regards Donkey for a moment before roaring very loudly.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: All right. This one's full. Take it away! Move it along. Come on! Get up!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Next!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (taking the witch's broom) Give me that! Your flying days are over. (breaks the broom in half)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's 20 pieces of silver for the witch. Next!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Get up! Come on!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Twenty pieces.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (crying) This cage is too small.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Please, don't turn me in. I'll never be stubborn again. I can change. Please! Give me another chance!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, shut up. (jerks his rope)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Next! What have you got?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This little wooden puppet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not a puppet. I'm a real boy. (his nose grows)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Five shillings for the possessed toy. Take it away.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Father, please! Don't let them do this! Help me!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Next! What have you got?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, I've got a talking donkey.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Right. Well, that's good for ten shillings, if you can prove it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, go ahead, little fella.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, oh, he's just...he's just a little nervous. He's really quite a chatterbox. Talk, you boneheaded dolt...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's it. I've heard enough. Guards!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, no, he talks! He does. (pretends to be Donkey) I can talk. I love to talk. I'm the talkingest damn thing you ever saw.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Get her out of my sight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, no! I swear! Oh! He can talk!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey! I can fly!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He can fly!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He can fly!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He can talk!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ha, ha! That's right, fool! Now I'm a flying, talking donkey. You might have seen a housefly, maybe even a superfly but I bet you ain't never seen a donkey fly. Ha, ha! (the pixie dust begins to wear off) Uh-oh. (he begins to sink to the ground.)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Seize him! (Donkey takes of running.) After him!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's getting away! Get him! This way! Turn!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You there. Ogre!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Aye?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: By the order of Lord Farquaad I am authorized to place you both under arrest and transport you to a designated resettlement facility.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, really? You and what army?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Can I say something to you? Listen, you was really, really, really somethin' back here. Incredible!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you talkin' to...(he turns around and Donkey is gone) me? (he turns back around and Donkey is right in front of him.) Whoa!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes. I was talkin' to you. Can I tell you that you that you was great back here? Those guards! They thought they was all of that. Then you showed up, and bam! They was trippin' over themselves like babes in the woods. That really made me feel good to see that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, that's great. Really.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Man, it's good to be free.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now, why don't you go celebrate your freedom with your own friends? Hmm?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But, uh, I don't have any friends. And I'm not goin' out there by myself. Hey, wait a minute! I got a great idea! I'll stick with you. You're mean, green, fightin' machine. Together we'll scare the spit out of anybody that crosses us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, wow! That was really scary. If you don't mind me sayin', if that don't work, your breath certainly will get the job done, 'cause you definitely need some Tic Tacs or something, 'cause you breath stinks! You almost burned the hair outta my nose, just like the time...(Shrek covers his mouth but Donkey continues to talk, so Shrek removes his hand.) ...then I ate some rotten berries. I had strong gases leaking out of my butt that day.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why are you following me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll tell you why. (singing) 'Cause I'm all alone, There's no one here beside me, My problems have all gone, There's no one to deride me, But you gotta have faith...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Stop singing! It's no wonder you don't have any friends.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wow. Only a true friend would be that cruelly honest.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Listen, little donkey. Take a look at me. What am I?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (looks all the way up at Shrek) Uh ...really tall?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No! I'm an ogre! You know. "Grab your torch and pitchforks." Doesn't that bother you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nope.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Really?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Really, really.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Man, I like you. What's you name?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Uh, Shrek.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shrek? Well, you know what I like about you, Shrek? You got that kind of I-don't-care-what-nobody-thinks-of-me thing. I like that. I respect that, Shrek. You all right. (They come over a hill and you can see Shrek's cottage.) Whoa! Look at that. Who'd want to live in place like that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That would be my home.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh! And it is lovely! Just beautiful. You know you are quite a decorator. It's amazing what you've done with such a modest budget. I like that boulder. That is a nice boulder. I guess you don't entertain much, do you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I like my privacy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know, I do too. That's another thing we have in common. Like I hate it when you got somebody in your face. You've trying to give them a hint, and they won't leave. There's that awkward silence. (awkward silence) Can I stay with you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Uh, what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Can I stay with you, please?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sarcastically) Of course!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Really?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Please! I don't wanna go back there! You don't know what it's like to be considered a freak. (pause while he looks at Shrek) Well, maybe you do. But that's why we gotta stick together. You gotta let me stay! Please! Please!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay! Okay! But one night only.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ah! Thank you! (he runs inside the cottage)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you...? (Donkey hops up onto a chair.) No! No!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is gonna be fun! We can stay up late, swappin' manly stories, and in the mornin' I'm makin' waffles.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where do, uh, I sleep?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (irritated) Outside!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, well, I guess that's cool. I mean, I don't know you, and you don't know me, so I guess outside is best, you know. Here I go. Good night. (Shrek slams the door.) (sigh) I mean, I do like the outdoors. I'm a donkey. I was born outside. I'll just be sitting by myself outside, I guess, you know. By myself, outside. I'm all alone...there's no one here beside me...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Shrek is getting ready for dinner. He sits himself down and lights a candle made out of earwax. He begins to eat when he hears a noise. He stands up with a huff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is another noise and Shrek turns to find the person that made the noise. He sees several shadows moving. He finally turns and spots 3 blind mice on his table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shrek marches over to the bedroom and throws back the curtain. The Big Bad Wolf is sitting in the bed. The wolf just looks at him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to Donkey) I thought I told you to stay outside.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (from the window) I am outside.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, gents, it's a far cry from the farm, but what choice do we have?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's not home, but it'll do just fine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (bouncing on a slug) What a lovely bed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Got ya. (Grabs a mouse, but it escapes and lands on his shoulder.)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I found some cheese. (bites Shrek's ear)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ow!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Blah! Awful stuff.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is that you, Gordo?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How did you know?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Enough! (he grabs the 3 mice) What are you doing in my house? (He gets bumped from behind and he drops the mice.) Hey! (he turns and sees the Seven Dwarves with Snow White on the table.) Oh, no, no, no. Dead broad off the table.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where are we supposed to put her? The bed's taken.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Huh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Shrek now has the Big Bad Wolf by the collar and is dragging him to the front door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The 3 bears sit around the fire, the pied piper is playing his pipe and the rats are all running to him, some elves are directing flight traffic so that the fairies and witches can land...etc.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gasps are heard all around. The 3 good fairies hide inside a tent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone looks around at each other but no one answers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Donkey begins to hum 'On the Road Again'.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I live in a swamp. I put up signs. I'm a terrifying ogre! What do I have to do get a little privacy? (He opens the front door to throw the Wolf out and he sees that all the collected Fairy Tale Creatures are on his land.) Oh, no. No! No!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you doing in my swamp? (this echoes and everyone falls silent.)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right, get out of here. All of you, move it! Come on! Let's go! Hapaya! Hapaya! Hey! Quickly. Come on! (more dwarves run inside the house) No, no! No, no. Not there. Not there. (they shut the door on him) Oh! (turns to look at Donkey)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, don't look at me. I didn't invite them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, gosh, no one invited us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We were forced to come here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (flabbergasted) By who?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Lord Farquaad. He huffed and he puffed and he...signed an eviction notice.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (heavy sigh) All right. Who knows where this Farquaad guy is?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, I do. I know where he is.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Does anyone else know where to find him? Anyone at all?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Me! Me!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Anyone?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh! Oh, pick me! Oh, I know! I know! Me, me!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sigh) Okay, fine. Attention, all fairy tale things. Do not get comfortable. Your welcome is officially worn out. In fact, I'm gonna see this guy Farquaad right now and get you all off my land and back where you came from! (Pause. Then the crowd goes wild.) Oh! (to Donkey) You! You're comin' with me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right, that's what I like to hear, man. Shrek and Donkey, two stalwart friends, off on a whirlwind big-city adventure. I love it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (singing) On the road again. Sing it with me, Shrek. I can't wait to get on the road again.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What did I say about singing?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Can I whistle?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Can I hum it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right, hum it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - KITCHEN A masked man is torturing the Gingerbread Man. He's continually dunking him in a glass of milk. Lord Farquaad walks in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Gingerbread Man is pulled out of the milk and slammed down onto a cookie sheet. Farquaad laughs as he walks over to the table. However when he reaches the table we see that it goes up to his eyes. He clears his throat and the table is lowered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The door opens and the Head Guard walks in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: More guards enter carrying something that is covered by a sheet. They hang up whatever it is and remove the sheet. It is the Magic Mirror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: DuLoc Parking Lot - Lancelot Section Shrek and Donkey come out of the field that is right by the parking lot. The castle itself is about 40 stories high.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: That's enough. He's ready to talk.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (he picks up the Gingerbread Man's legs and plays with them) Run, run, run, as fast as you can. You can't catch me. I'm the gingerbread man.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You are a monster.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not the monster here. You are. You and the rest of that fairy tale trash, poisoning my perfect world. Now, tell me! Where are the others?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Eat me! (He spits milk into Farquaad's eye.)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've tried to be fair to you creatures. Now my patience has reached its end! Tell me or I'll...(he makes as if to pull off the Gingerbread Man's buttons)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, no, not the buttons. Not my gumdrop buttons.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right then. Who's hiding them?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay, I'll tell you. Do you know the muffin man?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The muffin man?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The muffin man.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, I know the muffin man, who lives on Drury Lane?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, she's married to the muffin man.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The muffin man?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The muffin man!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She's married to the muffin man.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My lord! We found it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then what are you waiting for? Bring it in.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (in awe) Ohhhh...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Magic mirror...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't tell him anything! (Farquaad picks him up and dumps him into a trash can with a lid.) No!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Evening. Mirror, mirror on the wall. Is this not the most perfect kingdom of them all?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, technically you're not a king.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Uh, Thelonius. (Thelonius holds up a hand mirror and smashes it with his fist.) You were saying?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What I mean is you're not a king yet. But you can become one. All you have to do is marry a princess.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Go on.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (chuckles nervously) So, just sit back and relax, my lord, because it's time for you to meet today's eligible bachelorettes. And here they are! Bachelorette number one is a mentally abused shut-in from a kingdom far, far away. She likes sushi and hot tubbing anytime. Her hobbies include cooking and cleaning for her two evil sisters. Please welcome Cinderella. (shows picture of Cinderella) Bachelorette number two is a cape-wearing girl from the land of fancy. Although she lives with seven other men, she's not easy. Just kiss her dead, frozen lips and find out what a live wire she is. Come on. Give it up for Snow White! (shows picture of Snow White) And last, but certainly not last, bachelorette number three is a fiery redhead from a dragon-guarded castle surrounded by hot boiling lava! But don't let that cool you off. She's a loaded pistol who likes pina colads and getting caught in the rain. Yours for the rescuing, Princess Fiona! (Shows picture of Princess Fiona) So will it be bachelorette number one, bachelorette number two or bachelorette number three?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Two! Two! Three! Three! Two! Two! Three!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Three? One? Three?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Three! (holds up 2 fingers) Pick number three, my lord!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay, okay, uh, number three!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Lord Farquaad, you've chosen Princess Fiona.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Princess Fiona. She's perfect. All I have to do is just find someone who can go...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But I probably should mention the little thing that happens at night.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll do it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, but after sunset...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Silence! I will make this Princess Fiona my queen, and DuLoc will finally have the perfect king! Captain, assemble your finest men. We're going to have a tournament. (smiles evilly)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But that's it. That's it right there. That's DuLoc. I told ya I'd find it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So, that must be Lord Farquaad's castle.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Uh-huh. That's the place.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you think maybe he's compensating for something? (He laughs, but then groans as Donkey doesn't get the joke. He continues walking through the parking lot.)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, wait. Wait up, Shrek.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hurry, darling. We're late. Hurry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, you! (The attendant, who is wearing a giant head that looks like Lord Farquaad, screams and begins running through the rows of rope to get to the front gate to get away from Shrek.) Wait a second. Look, I'm not gonna eat you. I just - - I just - - (He sighs and then begins walking straight through the rows. The attendant runs into a wall and falls down. Shrek and Donkey look at him then continue on into DuLoc.)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: They look around but all is quiet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Donkey runs over and pulls a lever that is attached to a box marked 'Information'. The music winds up and then the box doors open up. There are little wooden people inside and they begin to sing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here we have some rules Let us lay them down Don't make waves, stay in line And we'll get along fine DuLoc is perfect place Please keep off of the grass Shine your shoes, wipe your... face DuLoc is, DuLoc is DuLoc is perfect place. Suddenly a camera takes Donkey and Shrek's picture.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They hear a trumpet fanfare and head over to the arena.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Shrek and Donkey walk down the tunnel to get into the arena Donkey is humming the DuLoc theme song.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He takes the mug and smashes the spigot off the large barrel of beer behind him. The beer comes rushing out drenching the other men and wetting the ground. It's like mud now. Shrek slides past the men and picks up a spear that one of the men dropped. As Shrek begins to fight Donkey hops up onto one of the larger beer barrels. It breaks free of it's ropes and begins to roll. Donkey manages to squish two men into the mud. There is so much fighting going on here I'm not going to go into detail. Suffice to say that Shrek kicks butt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shrek comes over and bangs a man's head up against Donkeys. Shrek gets up on the ropes and interacts with the crowd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A man tries to sneak up behind Shrek, but Shrek turns in time and sees him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shrek smashes a chair over the guys back. Finally all the men are down. Donkey kicks one of them in the helmet, and the ding sounds the end of the match. The audience goes wild.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The laughter stops as all of the guards turn their weapons on Shrek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Time Lapse - Donkey and Shrek are now walking through the field heading away from DuLoc. Shrek is munching on an onion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They head off. There is a montage of their journey. Walking through a field at sunset. Sleeping beneath a bright moon. Shrek trying to put the campfire out the next day and having a bit of a problem, so Donkey pees on the fire to put it out.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It's quiet. Too quiet. Where is everybody?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, look at this!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Welcome to DuLoc such a perfect town
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wow! Let's do that again! (makes ready to run over and pull the lever again)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (grabs Donkey's tail and holds him still) No. No. No, no, no! No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Brave knights. You are the best and brightest in all the land. Today one of you shall prove himself...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right. You're going the right way for a smacked bottom.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sorry about that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That champion shall have the honor - - no, no - - the privilege to go forth and rescue the lovely Princess Fiona from the fiery keep of the dragon. If for any reason the winner is unsuccessful, the first runner-up will take his place and so on and so forth. Some of you may die, but it's a sacrifice I am willing to make. (cheers) Let the tournament begin! (He notices Shrek) Oh! What is that? It's hideous!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (turns to look at Donkey and then back at Farquaad) Ah, that's not very nice. It's just a donkey.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Indeed. Knights, new plan! The one who kills the ogre will be named champion! Have it him!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Get him!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, hey! Now come on! Hang on now. (bumps into a table where there are mugs of beer)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Go ahead! Get him!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (holds up a mug of beer) Can't we just settle this over a pint?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Kill the beast!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No? All right then. (drinks the beer) Come on!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, Shrek, tag me! Tag me!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The chair! Give him the chair!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, yeah! Ah! Ah! Thank you! Thank you very much! I'm here till Thursday. Try the veal! Ha, ha! (laughs)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shall I give the order, sir?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, I have a better idea. People of DuLoc, I give you our champion!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Congratulations, ogre. You're won the honor of embarking on a great and noble quest.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Quest? I'm already in a quest, a quest to get my swamp back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your swamp?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, my swamp! Where you dumped those fairy tale creatures!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Indeed. All right, ogre. I'll make you a deal. Go on this quest for me, and I'll give you your swamp back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Exactly the way it was?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Down to the last slime-covered toadstool.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And the squatters?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: As good as gone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What kind of quest?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let me get this straight. You're gonna go fight a dragon and rescue a princess just so Farquaad will give you back a swamp which you only don't have because he filled it full of freaks in the first place. Is that about right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know, maybe there's a good reason donkeys shouldn't talk.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't get it. Why don't you just pull some of that ogre stuff on him? Throttle him, lay siege to his fortress, grinds his bones to make your bread, the whole ogre trip.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, I know what. Maybe I could have decapitated an entire village and put their heads on a pike, gotten a knife, cut open their spleen and drink their fluids. Does that sound good to you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Uh, no, not really, no.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: For your information, there's a lot more to ogres than people think.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Example?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Example? Okay, um, ogres are like onions. (he holds out his onion)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sniffs the onion) They stink?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes - - No!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They make you cry?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You leave them in the sun, they get all brown, start sproutin' little white hairs.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No! Layers! Onions have layers. Ogres have layers! Onions have layers. You get it? We both have layers. (he heaves a sigh and then walks off)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (trailing after Shrek) Oh, you both have layers. Oh. {Sniffs} You know, not everybody likes onions. Cake! Everybody loves cakes! Cakes have layers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't care... what everyone likes. Ogres are not like cakes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know what else everybody likes? Parfaits. Have you ever met a person, you say, "Let's get some parfait," they say, "Hell no, I don't like no parfait"? Parfaits are delicious.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No! You dense, irritating, miniature beast of burden! Ogres are like onions! And of story. Bye-bye. See ya later.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Parfaits may be the most delicious thing on the whole damn planet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know, I think I preferred your humming.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you have a tissue or something? I'm making a mess. Just the word parfait make me start slobbering.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Shrek and Donkey are walking up to the keep that's supposed to house Princess Fiona. It appears to look like a giant volcano.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They climb up the side of the volcano/keep and look down. There is a small piece of rock right in the center and that is where the castle is. It is surrounded by boiling lava. It looks very foreboding.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (sniffs) Ohh! Shrek! Did you do that? You gotta warn somebody before you just crack one off. My mouth was open and everything.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Believe me, Donkey, if it was me, you'd be dead. (sniffs) It's brimstone. We must be getting close.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, right, brimstone. Don't be talking about it's the brimstone. I know what I smell. It wasn't no brimstone. It didn't come off no stone neither.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure, it's big enough, but look at the location. (laughs...then the laugh turns into a groan)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Uh, Shrek? Uh, remember when you said ogres have layers?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, aye.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, I have a bit of a confession to make. Donkeys don't have layers. We wear our fear right out there on our sleeves.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wait a second. Donkeys don't have sleeves.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know what I mean.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You can't tell me you're afraid of heights.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, I'm just a little uncomfortable about being on a rickety bridge over a boiling like of lava!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come on, Donkey. I'm right here beside ya, okay? For emotional support., we'll just tackle this thing together one little baby step at a time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Really?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Really, really.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay, that makes me feel so much better.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just keep moving. And don't look down.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay, don't look down. Don't look down. Don't look down. Keep on moving. Don't look down. (he steps through a rotting board and ends up looking straight down into the lava) Shrek! I'm lookin' down! Oh, God, I can't do this! Just let me off, please!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But you're already halfway.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But I know that half is safe!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay, fine. I don't have time for this. You go back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shrek, no! Wait!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just, Donkey - - Let's have a dance then, shall me? (bounces and sways the bridge)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't do that!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, I'm sorry. Do what? Oh, this? (bounces the bridge again)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, that!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes? Yes, do it. Okay. (continues to bounce and sway as he backs Donkey across the bridge)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, Shrek! No! Stop it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You said do it! I'm doin' it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm gonna die. I'm gonna die. Shrek, I'm gonna die. (steps onto solid ground) Oh!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That'll do, Donkey. That'll do. (walks towards the castle)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cool. So where is this fire-breathing pain-in-the-neck anyway?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Inside, waiting for us to rescue her. (chuckles)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I was talkin' about the dragon, Shrek.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: You afraid?
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shh.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, good. Me neither. (sees a skeleton and gasps) 'Cause there's nothin' wrong with bein' afraid. Fear's a sensible response to an unfamiliar situation. Unfamiliar dangerous situation, I might add. With a dragon that breathes fire and eats knights and breathes fire, it sure doesn't mean you're a coward if you're a little scared. I sure as heck ain't no coward. I know that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Donkey, two things, okay? Shut ... up. Now go over there and see if you can find any stairs.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Stairs? I thought we was lookin' for the princess.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (putting on a helmet) The princess will be up the stairs in the highest room in the tallest tower.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What makes you think she'll be there?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I read it in a book once. (walks off)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cool. You handle the dragon. I'll handle the stairs. I'll find those stairs. I'll whip their butt too. Those stairs won't know which way they're goin'. (walks off)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Donkey is still talking to himself as he looks around the room.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I'm gonna take drastic steps. Kick it to the curb. Don't mess with me. I'm the stair master. I've mastered the stairs. I wish I had a step right here. I'd step all over it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Shrek spots a light in the tallest tower window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Donkey gasps and takes off running as the dragon roars again. Shrek manages to grab Donkey out of the way just as the dragon breathes fire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The dragon gets irritated at this and flicks it's tail and Shrek goes flying through the air and crashes through the roof of the tallest tower. Fiona wakes up with a jerk and looks at him lying on the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Donkey get cornered as the Dragon knocks away all but a small part of the bridge he's on.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Well, at least we know where the princess is, but where's the...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (os) Dragon!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Donkey, look out! (he manages to get a hold of the dragons tail and holds on) Got ya!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh! Aah! Aah!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. Oh, no, No! (the dragon roars) Oh, what large teeth you have. (the dragon growls) I mean white, sparkling teeth. I know you probably hear this all time from your food, but you must bleach, 'cause that is one dazzling smile you got there. Do I detect a hint of minty freshness? And you know what else? You're - - You're a girl dragon! Oh, sure! I mean, of course you're a girl dragon. You're just reeking of feminine beauty. (the dragon begins fluttering her eyes at him) What's the matter with you? You got something in your eye? Ohh. Oh. Oh. Man, I'd really love to stay, but you know, I'm, uh...(the dragon blows a smoke ring in the shape of a heart right at him, and he coughs) I'm an asthmatic, and I don't know if it'd work out if you're gonna blow smoke rings. Shrek! (the dragon picks him up with her teeth and carries him off) No! Shrek! Shrek! Shrek!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Shrek groans as he gets up off the floor. His back is to Fiona so she straightens her dress and lays back down on the bed. She then quickly reaches over and gets the bouquet of flowers off the side table. She then lays back down and appears to be asleep. Shrek turns and goes over to her. He looks down at Fiona for a moment and she puckers her lips. Shrek takes her by the shoulders and shakes her away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shrek breaks the lock on her door and pulls her out and down the hallway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly they hear the dragon roar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shrek grabs a chain that's connected to the chandelier and swings toward the dragon. He misses and he swings back again. He looks up and spots that the chandelier is right above the dragons head. He pulls on the chain and it releases and he falls down and bumps Donkey out of the way right as the dragon is about to kiss him. Instead the dragon kisses Shreks' butt. She opens her eyes and roars. Shrek lets go of the chain and the chandelier falls onto her head, but it's too big and it goes over her head and forms a sort of collar for her. She roars again and Shrek and Donkey take off running. Very 'Matrix' style. Shrek grabs Donkey and then grabs Princess Fiona as he runs past her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They all start screaming as the dragon gains on them. Shrek spots a descending slide and jumps on. But unfortunately there is a crack in the stone and it hits Shrek right in the groin. His eyes cross and as he reaches the bottom of the slide he stumbles off and walks lightly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shrek gets them close to the exit and sets down Donkey and Fiona.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shrek grabs a sword and heads back toward the interior of the castle. He throws the sword down in between several overlapping chain links. The chain links are attached to the chandelier that is still around the dragons neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They all take off running for the exit with the dragon in hot pursuit. They make it to the bridge and head across. The dragons breathes fire and the bridge begins to burn. They all hang on for dear life as the ropes holding the bridge up collapse. They are swung to the other side. As they hang upside down they look in horror as the dragon makes to fly over the boiling lava to get them. But suddenly the chandelier with the chain jerk the dragon back and she's unable to get to them. Our gang climbs quickly to safety as the dragon looks angry and then gives a sad whimper as she watches Donkey walk away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Both Donkey and Shrek burst out laughing.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Oh! Oh!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wake up!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you Princess Fiona?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I am, awaiting a knight so bold as to rescue me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, that's nice. Now let's go!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But wait, Sir Knight. This be-ith our first meeting. Should it not be a wonderful, romantic moment?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, sorry, lady. There's no time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, wait. What are you doing? You should sweep me off my feet out yonder window and down a rope onto your valiant steed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You've had a lot of time to plan this, haven't you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smiles) Mm-hmm.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But we have to savor this moment! You could recite an epic poem for me. A ballad? A sonnet! A limerick? Or something!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't think so.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Can I at least know the name of my champion?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Uh, Shrek.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sir Shrek. (clears throat and holds out a handkerchief) I pray that you take this favor as a token of my gratitude.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thanks!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (surprised)You didn't slay the dragon?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's on my to-do list. Now come on! (takes off running and drags Fiona behind him.)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But this isn't right! You were meant to charge in, sword drawn, banner flying. That's what all the other knights did.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, right before they burst into flame.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's not the point. (Shrek suddenly stops and she runs into him.) Oh! (Shrek ignores her and heads for a wooden door off to the side.) Wait. Where are you going? The exit's over there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, I have to save my ass.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What kind of knight are you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: One of a kind. (opens the door into the throne room)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (os) Slow down. Slow down, baby, please. I believe it's healthy to get to know someone over a long period of time. Just call me old-fashioned. (laughs worriedly) (we see him up close and from a distance as Shrek sneaks into the room) I don't want to rush into a physical relationship. I'm not emotionally ready for a commitment of, uh, this - - Magnitude really is the word I'm looking for. Magnitude- - Hey, that is unwanted physical contact. Hey, what are you doing? Okay, okay. Let's just back up a little and take this one step at a time. We really should get to know each other first as friends or pen pals. I'm on the road a lot, but I just love receiving cards - - I'd really love to stay, but - - Don't do that! That's my tail! That's my personal tail. You're gonna tear it off. I don't give permission - - What are you gonna do with that? Hey, now. No way. No! No! No, no! No. No, no, no. No! Oh!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hi, Princess!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It talks!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, it's getting him to shut up that's the trick.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay, you two, heard for the exit! I'll take care of the dragon.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (echoing) Run!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sliding down the 'volcano' hill) You did it! You rescued me! You're amazing. (behind her Donkey falls down the hill) You're - - You're wonderful. You're... (turns and sees Shrek fall down the hill and bump into Donkey) a little unorthodox I'll admit. But thy deed is great, and thy heart is pure. I am eternally in your debt. (Donkey clears his throat.) And where would a brave knight be without his noble steed?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I hope you heard that. She called me a noble steed. She think I'm a steed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The battle is won. You may remove your helmet, good Sir Knight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Uh, no.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why not?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have helmet hair.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Please. I would'st look upon the face of my rescuer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, no, you wouldn't - - 'st.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But how will you kiss me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What? (to Donkey) That wasn't in the job description.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe it's a perk.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, it's destiny. Oh, you must know how it goes. A princess locked in a tower and beset by a dragon is rescued by a brave knight, and then they share true love's first kiss.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hmm? With Shrek? You think- - Wait. Wait. You think that Shrek is you true love?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You think Shrek is your true love!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What is so funny?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let's just say I'm not your type, okay?Fiona: Of course, you are. You're my rescuer. Now - - Now remove your helmet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look. I really don't think this is a good idea.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just take off the helmet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not going to.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Take it off.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay! Easy. As you command. Your Highness. (takes off his helmet)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You- - You're a- - an ogre.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, you were expecting Prince Charming.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, yes, actually. Oh, no. This is all wrong. You're not supposed to be an ogre.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Princess, I was sent to rescue you by Lord Farquaad, okay? He is the one who wants to marry you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then why didn't he come rescue me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good question. You should ask him that when we get there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But I have to be rescued by my true love, not by some ogre and his- - his pet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, so much for noble steed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're not making my job any easier.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sorry, but your job is not my problem. You can tell Lord Farquaad that if he wants to rescue me properly, I'll be waiting for him right here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey! I'm no one's messenger boy, all right? (ominous) I'm a delivery boy. (he swiftly picks her up and swings her over his shoulder like she was a sack of potatoes)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You wouldn't dare. Put me down!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ya comin', Donkey?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm right behind ya.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Put me down, or you will suffer the consequences! This is not dignified! Put me down!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A little time has passed and Fiona has calmed down. She just hangs there limply while Shrek carries her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shrek then proceeds to splash water onto his face to wash off the dust and grime.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Both Donkey and Shrek's ears lower as they shrink away from her.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Okay, so here's another question. Say there's a woman that digs you, right, but you don't really like her that way. How do you let her down real easy so her feelings aren't hurt, but you don't get burned to a crisp and eaten?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You just tell her she's not your true love. Everyone knows what happens when you find your...(Shrek drops her on the ground) Hey! The sooner we get to DuLoc the better.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're gonna love it there, Princess. It's beautiful!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And what of my groom-to-be? Lord Farquaad? What's he like?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let me put it this way, Princess. Men of Farquaad's stature are in short supply. (he and Donkey laugh)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know. There are those who think little of him. (they laugh again) Fiona: Stop it. Stop it, both of you. You're just jealous you can never measure up to a great ruler like Lord Farquaad.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, well, maybe you're right, Princess. But I'll let you do the "measuring" when you see him tomorrow.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (looks at the setting sun) Tomorrow? It'll take that long? Shouldn't we stop to make camp?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, that'll take longer. We can keep going.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But there's robbers in the woods.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Whoa! Time out, Shrek! Camp is starting to sound good.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, come on. I'm scarier than anything we're going to see in this forest.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I need to find somewhere to camp now!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Shrek has found a cave that appears to be in good order. He shoves a stone boulder out of the way to reveal the cave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shrek looks at Donkey for a second and then goes to move the boulder back in front of the entrance to the cave with Fiona still inside.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hey! Over here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shrek, we can do better than that. I don't think this is fit for a princess.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, no, it's perfect. It just needs a few homey touches.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Homey touches? Like what? (he hears a tearing noise and looks over at Fiona who has torn the bark off of a tree.)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A door? Well, gentlemen, I bid thee good night. (goes into the cave and puts the bark door up behind her)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You want me to read you a bedtime story? I will.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (os) I said good night!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shrek, What are you doing?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (laughs) I just- - You know - - Oh, come on. I was just kidding.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Shrek and Donkey are sitting around a campfire. They are staring up into the sky as Shrek points out certain star constellations to Donkey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At this point Fiona pulls the 'door' away from the entrance to the cave and peaks out. Neither of the guys see her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fiona puts the door back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: DuLoc - Farquaad's Bedroom The camera pans over a lot of wedding stuff. Soft music plays in the background. Farquaad is in bed, watching as the Magic Mirror shows him Princess Fiona.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What's the point of being able to talk if you gotta keep secrets?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Promise you won't tell. Promise!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right, all right. I won't tell him. But you should. (goes outside) I just know before this is over, I'm gonna need a whole lot of serious therapy. Look at my eye twitchin'.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Donkey is asleep. Shrek is nowhere to be seen. Fiona is still awake. She is plucking petals from the sunflower.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just as she looks back at the sun she sees Shrek stomping towards her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Farquaad has arrived with a group of his men. He looks very regal sitting up on his horse. You would never guess that he's only like 3 feet tall. Donkey wakes up with a yawn as the soldiers march by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Donkey watches this exchange with a curious look on his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Farquaad's whole party begins to head back to DuLoc. Donkey watches them go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Montage of different scenes. Shrek arriving back home. Fiona being fitted for the wedding dress. Donkey at a stream running into the dragon. Shrek cleaning up his house. Fiona eating dinner alone. Shrek eating dinner alone.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I tell him, I tell him not. I tell him, I tell him not. I tell him. (she quickly runs to the door and goes outside) Shrek! Shrek, there's something I want...(she looks and sees the rising sun, and as the sun crests the sky she turns back into a human.)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shrek. Are you all right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Perfect! Never been better.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: - - I don't - - There's something I have to tell you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You don't have to tell me anything, Princess. I heard enough last night.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You heard what I said?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Every word.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I thought you'd understand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, I understand. Like you said, "Who could love a hideous, ugly beast?"
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But I thought that wouldn't matter to you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah? Well, it does. (Fiona looks at him in shock. He looks past her and spots a group approaching.) Ah, right on time. Princess, I've brought you a little something.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What'd I miss? What'd I miss? (spots the soldiers) (muffled) Who said that? Couldn't have been the donkey.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Princess Fiona.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: As promised. Now hand it over.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Very well, ogre. (holds out a piece of paper) The deed to your swamp, cleared out, as agreed. Take it and go before I change my mind. (Shrek takes the paper) Forgive me, Princess, for startling you, but you startled me, for I have never seen such a radiant beauty before. I'm Lord Farquaad.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Lord Farquaad? Oh, no, no. (Farquaad snaps his fingers) Forgive me, my lord, for I was just saying a short... (Watches as Farquaad is lifted off his horse and set down in front of her. He comes to her waist.) farewell.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, that is so sweet. You don't have to waste good manners on the ogre. It's not like it has feelings.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, you're right. It doesn't.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Princess Fiona, beautiful, fair, flawless Fiona. I ask your hand in marriage. Will you be the perfect bride for the perfect groom?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Lord Farquaad, I accept. Nothing would make - -
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (interrupting) Excellent! I'll start the plans, for tomorrow we wed!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No! I mean, uh, why wait? Let's get married today before the sun sets.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, anxious, are you? You're right. The sooner, the better. There's so much to do! There's the caterer, the cake, the band, the guest list. Captain, round up some guests! (a guard puts Fiona on the back of his horse)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fare-thee-well, ogre.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shrek, what are you doing? You're letting her get away.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah? So what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shrek, there's something about her you don't know. Look, I talked to her last night, She's - -
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know you talked to her last night. You're great pals, aren't ya? Now, if you two are such good friends, why don't you follow her home?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shrek, I - - I wanna go with you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I told you, didn't I? You're not coming home with me. I live alone! My swamp! Me! Nobody else! Understand? Nobody! Especially useless, pathetic, annoying, talking donkeys!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But I thought - -
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah. You know what? You thought wrong! (stomps off)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shrek.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Shrek is eating dinner when he hears a sound outside. He goes outside to investigate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly the dragon arrives overhead and flies low enough so they can climb on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They both laugh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They climb aboard the dragon and she takes off for DuLoc.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Donkey? (Donkey ignores him and continues with what he's doing.) What are you doing?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I would think, of all people, you would recognize a wall when you see one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, yeah. But the wall's supposed to go around my swamp, not through it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It is around your half. See that's your half, and this is my half.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh! Your half. Hmm.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, my half. I helped rescue the princess. I did half the work. I get half the booty. Now hand me that big old rock, the one that looks like your head.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Back off!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, you back off.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is my swamp!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Our swamp.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (grabs the tree branch Donkey is working with) Let go, Donkey!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You let go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Stubborn jackass!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Smelly ogre.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fine! (drops the tree branch and walks away)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, hey, come back here. I'm not through with you yet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, I'm through with you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Uh-uh. You know, with you it's always, "Me, me, me!" Well, guess what! Now it's my turn! So you just shut up and pay attention! You are mean to me. You insult me and you don't appreciate anything that I do! You're always pushing me around or pushing me away.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, yeah? Well, if I treated you so bad, how come you came back?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Because that's what friends do! They forgive each other!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, yeah. You're right, Donkey. I forgive you... for stabbin' me in the back! (goes into the outhouse and slams the door)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ohh! You're so wrapped up in layers, onion boy, you're afraid of your own feelings.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (os) Go away!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There you are , doing it again just like you did to Fiona. All she ever do was like you, maybe even love you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (os) Love me? She said I was ugly, a hideous creature. I heard the two of you talking.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She wasn't talkin' about you. She was talkin' about, uh, somebody else.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (opens the door and comes out) She wasn't talking about me? Well, then who was she talking about?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Uh-uh, no way. I ain't saying anything. You don't wanna listen to me. Right? Right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Donkey!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay, look. I'm sorry, all right? (sigh) I'm sorry. I guess I am just a big, stupid, ugly ogre. Can you forgive me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, that's what friends are for, right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Right. Friends?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Friends.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So, um, what did Fiona say about me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you asking me for? Why don't you just go ask her?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The wedding! We'll never make it in time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ha-ha-ha! Never fear, for where, there's a will, there's a way and I have a way. (whistles)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Donkey?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I guess it's just my animal magnetism.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Aw, come here, you. (gives Donkey a noogie)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right, all right. Don't get all slobbery. No one likes a kiss ass. All right, hop on and hold on tight. I haven't had a chance to install the seat belts yet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - CHURCH Fiona and Farquaad are getting married. The whole town is there. The prompter card guy holds up a card that says 'Revered Silence'.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: People of DuLoc, we gather here today to bear witness to the union....
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (eyeing the setting sun) Um-
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...of our new king...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Excuse me. Could we just skip ahead to the "I do's"?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (chuckles and then motions to the priest to indulge Fiona) Go on.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Some guards are milling around. Suddenly the dragon lands with a boom. The guards all take off running.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to Dragon) Go ahead, HAVE SOME FUN. If we need you, I'll whistle. How about that? (she nods and goes after the guards) Shrek, wait, wait! Wait a minute! You wanna do this right, don't you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (at the Church door) What are you talking about?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There's a line you gotta wait for. The preacher's gonna say, "Speak now or forever hold your peace." That's when you say, "I object!"
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't have time for this!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, wait. What are you doing? Listen to me! Look, you love this woman, don't you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You wanna hold her?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Please her?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (singing James Brown style) Then you got to, got to try a little tenderness. (normal) The chicks love that romantic crap!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right! Cut it out. When does this guy say the line?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We gotta check it out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: As the priest talks we see Donkey's shadow through one of the windows Shrek tosses him up so he can see.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Outside
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Inside
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Outside
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Inside
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Outside
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He runs inside without catching Donkey, who hits the ground hard.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: And so, by the power vested in me...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you see?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The whole town's in there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I now pronounce you husband and wife...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They're at the altar.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...king and queen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mother Fletcher! He already said it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, for the love of Pete!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: (running toward the alter) I object!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The whole congregation gasps as they see Shrek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The prompter card guy holds up a card that says 'Laugh'. The whole congregation laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She backs up and as the sun sets she changes into her ogre self. She gives Shrek a sheepish smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The guards run in and separate Fiona and Shrek. Shrek fights them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shrek manages to get a hand free and he whistles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The dragon belches and Farquaad's crown flies out of her mouth and falls to the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The congregation cheers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shrek and Fiona kiss. Thelonius takes one of the cards and writes 'Awwww' on the back and then shows it to the congregation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly the magic of the spell pulls Fiona away. She's lifted up into the air and she hovers there while the magic works around her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly Fiona's eyes open wide. She's consumed by the spell and then is slowly lowered to the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They smile at each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shrek and Fiona kiss...and the kiss fades into...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Shrek?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, now what does he want?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to congregation as he reaches the front of the Church) Hi, everyone. Havin' a good time, are ya? I love DuLoc, first of all. Very clean.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you doing here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Really, it's rude enough being alive when no one wants you, but showing up uninvited to a wedding...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fiona! I need to talk to you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, now you wanna talk? It's a little late for that, so if you'll excuse me - -
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But you can't marry him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And why not?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Because- - Because he's just marring you so he can be king.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Outrageous! Fiona, don't listen to him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's not your true love.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And what do you know about true love?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, I - - Uh - - I mean - -
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, this is precious. The ogee has fallen in love with the princess! Oh, good Lord. (laughs)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: An ogre and a princess!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shrek, is this true?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who cares? It's preposterous! Fiona, my love, we're but a kiss away from our "happily ever after." Now kiss me! (puckers his lips and leans toward her, but she pulls back.)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (looking at the setting sun) "By night one way, by day another." (to Shrek) I wanted to show you before.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, uh, that explains a lot. (Fiona smiles)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ugh! It's disgusting! Guards! Guards! I order you to get that out of my sight now! Get them! Get them both!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, no!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shrek!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This hocus-pocus alters nothing. This marriage is binding, and that makes me king! See? See?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, let go of me! Shrek!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't just stand there, you morons.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Get out of my way! Fiona! Arrgh!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll make you regret the day we met. I'll see you drawn and quartered! You'll beg for death to save you!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, Shrek!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (hold a dagger to Fiona's throat) And as for you, my wife...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fiona!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll have you locked back in that tower for the rest of your days! I'm king!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I will have order! I will have perfection! I will have - - (Donkey and the dragon show up and the dragon leans down and eats Farquaad) Aaaah! Aah!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right. Nobody move. I got a dragon here, and I'm not afraid to use it. (The dragon roars.) I'm a donkey on the edge!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Celebrity marriages. They never last, do they?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Go ahead, Shrek.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Uh, Fiona?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, Shrek?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: - - I love you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Really?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Really, really.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smiles) I love you too.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Aawww!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: "Until you find true love's first kiss and then take love's true form. Take love's true form. Take love's true form."
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (going over to her) Fiona? Fiona. Are you all right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (standing up, she's still an ogre) Well, yes. But I don't understand. I'm supposed to be beautiful.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But you ARE beautiful.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (chuckles) I was hoping this would be a happy ending.
dialogue.name: dialogue
